title: The terrifying new weapon changing the war in Ukraine
content: The BBC reports from Donetsk where swarms of fibre optic drones give Russia the edge as Ukraine defends towns behind the front line.

title: EU says Israeli strikes in Gaza 'go beyond what is necessary' to fight Hamas
content: Kaja Kallas, the EU's top diplomat, says the bloc also does not support a new aid distribution model which bypasses the UN and other humanitarian organisations.

title: Israel PM says Hamas's Gaza chief Mohammed Sinwar has been killed
content: Mohammed Sinwar was the target of a Israeli strike on the courtyard of the European hospital in Khan Younis on 13 May.

title: Glacier collapse buries most of Swiss village
content: Many homes in Blatten have been flattened after a large chunk of the Birch glacier fell on to the village.

title: French paedophile surgeon who abused hundreds sentenced to 20 years in jail
content: Joel Le Scouarnec, who has admitted his guilt, said last week he neither wanted nor expected to be shown leniency.

title: German chancellor promises to help Ukraine produce long-range missiles
content: Friedrich Merz said earlier there were "no longer" any range restrictions on weapons supplied by Kyiv's Western allies.

title: Musk 'disappointed' by Trump's tax and spending bill
content: As the former Doge chief, Musk had worked to reduce government spending which he says this bill contradicts.

title: German court rejects Peruvian farmer's landmark climate case
content: Saúl Luciano Lliuya believes energy giant RWE should be held responsible for melting glaciers.

title: Indian man who disguised parcel bomb as wedding gift jailed for life
content: The bomb, disguised as a wedding gift, killed a software engineer and his great aunt just days after his wedding in 2018.

title: Kenyan president apologises to Tanzania over deportation row
content: It follows growing criticism from Kenyans targeting Tanzania's president over the recent deportation of activists.

title: Norwegian princess moves to Australia for university
content: Princess Ingrid Alexandra, who is second in line to the throne, will study at the University of Sydney.

title: Canada 'strong and free' and other takeaways from King's throne speech
content: King Charles delivered the first throne speech in Canada by a monarch since 1977, amid tensions with the US.

title: Australia's Liberal-National coalition reunite a week after split
content: The two conservative parties have negotiated on key policy issues in a bid to mend the rift

title: Trump administration seeks to pull estimated $100m in Harvard funding
content: Federal agencies will review their grants to the top university to decide whether they should be terminated.

title: Orban accused of using Ukraine spy row in fight for political survival
content: Relations between war-torn Ukraine and its Nato neighbour Hungary plummet to a new low.

title: Hopes of parenthood crushed after IVF embryos destroyed in Israel's Gaza offensive
content: Couples in Gaza using IVF to help them conceive “left with nothing” after 4,000 embryos at an IVF clinic were destroyed.

title: How 'laughing gas' became a deadly - but legal - American addiction
content: Nitrous oxide overdoses have increased in the US, but the substance is still legal as a "culinary product".

title: Namibia marks colonial genocide for first time with memorial day
content: Concentration camps and pseudoscientific experiments were used by German officials to torture and kill.

title: After decades of bloodshed, is India winning its war against Maoists?
content: The Maoist insurgency has claimed nearly 12,000 lives in India since 2000.

title: King's Canadian speech doesn't mention you-know-who
content: There were calls for Canada to remain "strong and free" in what King Charles called a "critical moment".

title: Far-right marchers attack Palestinians as Israel marks taking of Jerusalem
content: Israeli opposition leaders condemned attacks on Palestinians as "racist" and a disgrace to Judaism.

title: Could Nigeria's careful ethnic balancing act be under threat?
content: Criticism is growing after several top positions go to members of the president's ethnic Yoruba group.

title: Watch: BBC team flees drone attack in Ukraine
content: Yogita Limaye was reporting from the town of Rodynske when a blast was heard nearby.

title: Glacier collapse swallows part of Swiss village
content: One person has been reported missing and many homes have been flattened.

title: Moment SpaceX Starship spins out of control in test flight
content: Fuel leaks on the rocket caused it to begin spinning, leading to an uncontrolled re-entry through Earth's atmosphere.

title: Watch: Loose pigeons cause havoc on plane before take-off
content: A US flight was delayed after two birds ended up onboard the aircraft, baffling both passengers and crew.

title: Key highlights from the King's speech in Canada
content: A look at the King's historic 2025 visit to Ottawa and opening of the Canadian parliament.

title: Norway ship refloated after near miss with house
content: House owner Johan Helberg says he "wouldn't have traded this experience for anything" after the ship became stuck in his garden.
